body:
<!-- Describe the issue -->
[bloom.cpp](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/4cef8e05938e55d2d1bb3c36642aa294fb63b6e2/src/bloom.cpp#L122-L165)
[merkleblock.cpp](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/78dae8caccd82cfbfd76557f1fb7d7557c7b5edb/src/merkleblock.cpp#L28)
According to these 2 files, MerkleBlock checks BIP37 bloom filter match without reordering transactions. I assume this brings a result that it miss a tx which is supposed to be matched if it meets the following conditions.

- a block contains descendant transactions using existing filter's outpoint
- child tx comes before its parent

If the filter has `BLOOM_UPDATE_ALL` or `BLOOM_UPDATE_P2PUBKEY_ONLY`, It also fails BloomFilter auto updating.

I think it should re-order txs in a block to be canonical transaction order before the process of merkle block filter match
title: BIP37 BloomFilter might miss a tx which is supposed to be matched
